item.title: Install solr server
item.description: Here are the steps for Install solr server - base of search engine for magento these steps run on ubuntu 16.04, because we follow this http://devdocs.magento.com/guides/m1x/other/ht_magento-solr.html, we must install jdk 7 from ppa, but ubuntu 16.04 default with jdk 8 add-apt-repository ppa:openjdk-r/ppaapt updateapt-get install openjdk-7-jdkapt install supervisorsu - usermkdir apps && cd appswget https://archive.apache.org/dist/lucene/solr/3.4.0/apache-solr-3.4.0.tgztar xzf ../apache-solr-3.4.0.tgzmv apache-solr-3.4.0 solr34cp /var/www/magento/lib/Apache/Solr/conf/* solr34/example/solr/conf/cat >> apps/solr34/example/logging.properties # Default global logging level:.level = INFO# Write to a file:handlers = java.

item.title: Magento maintenance mode
item.description: To set magento 2 in maintenance mode and to make nice maintenance page.1. make / get maintenance image for our maintenance page, ie: maintenance.png2. put at pub/errors/default/images directory under magento root directory, ie: /var/www/magento/pub/errors/default/images/maintenance.png3. edit and save /var/www/magento/pub/errors/default/503.phtml4. run bin/magento maintenance:enable from magento root directorythat’s it, and you can see nicer maintenance mode in magento 2To set magento 1 in maintenance mode and to make nice maintenance page.1. make / get maintenance image for our maintenance page, ie: maintenance.
